definitions: An equation that describes the transport of a conserved quantity. It is a local form of the conservation law.

In fluid dynamics, an equation that states that the rate at which mass enters a system must be equal to the rate at which mass leaves the system plus the rate of accumulation of mass within the system.
examples: The continuity equation is fundamental in fluid mechanics.
Deriving the continuity equation is a common task in physics.
The continuity equation can be applied to electric charge.
